sentences.sentence: Georgia Maloney has been sworn in by the Italian president, becoming the country's first female premier and the first far-right leader since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As Ukrainian forces continue to advance in the south, President Zelenskyy accuses Moscow of deliberately delaying vital grain shipments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At the European Council summit, EU leaders attempt to remain united over energy policy as France becomes the latest country to break ranks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Maloney has been sworn in as Italy's first female prime minister and the country's first far-right leader to head the nation's government since the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: World War. Her coalition allies include the right-wing League of Matteo Salvini and the conservative Forza Italia party, headed by former Premier Silvio Berlusconi. 45-year-old Maloney took the oath of office before the Italian president Sergio Mattarella at the presidential palace on Saturday morning. The new leader had announced her cabinet on Friday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Her deputy and minister for foreign affairs is Antonio Tahini, a former journalist and soldier who served as president of the European Parliament between 2017 and 2019.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Although Maloney's Brothers of Italy party won the election taking 26% of the vote, she still needed the support of Matteo Salvini's anti-migrant League Party and former Premier Silvio Berlusconi's Forza Italia to form a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Their parties polled 8% of the vote each in the election, but saw a record low turnout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And although they'll all be working together, there have already been tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Berlusconi and Salvini are long-time admirers of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Maloney staunchly backs Ukraine in its defense against the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of deliberately delaying the passage of ships carrying vital grain supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He said Algeria, Bangladesh, China, Egypt, Indonesia, Iraq, Lebanon, Morocco and Tunisia were among the countries affected by the delays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy claimed over 150 vessels were queued up in ports waiting to sail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: ZELENSKYY, Russian President of the United States of America, During the operation of our grain initiative, due to the Russian slowdown, we underexported about 3 million tons of food.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that's the annual amount of consumption for 10 million people." The Ukrainian president also praised his armed forces in his video address.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He welcomed the capture of Russian military equipment in the southern Kherson region, where Moscow's troops face Kyiv's advancing counteroffensive. The president's office says 88 settlements have been de-occupied there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Citizens continue to leave Kherson as Russian and Ukrainian troops prepare for what observers think will be a major battle over the strategic southern city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Moscow has accused Ukraine of shelling a column of civilians fleeing Kherson, killing four and wounding 13.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: of shelling a column of civilians fleeing Hurson, killing four and wounding 13.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The country's longest reigning monarch, greeting the person who would become the UK's shortest-serving PM.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In a month and a half, Liz Truss has created unprecedented political turmoil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a great pleasure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What needs to happen now, well, on a UK level, there must be a general election it is a democratic necessity the idea that the Tories can unite behind a Prime Minister now any Prime Minister let alone one that is in the public interest I think is for the birds. What will actually happen next is a process designed in haste by Conservative Party backbenchers leaving nominees requiring more than 100 MPs to back their leadership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The frontrunners are Penny Mordaunt, the current leader of the House of Commons, Rishi Sunak, the former Chancellor who came second to Liz Truss, and, quite remarkably, the still popular Boris Johnson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There is now a genuine possibility that Rishi Sunak will be joined by Boris Johnson in a run-off to become the next Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Both Sunak and Johnson are the current favourites amongst Tory MPs who've been early to pledge their support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Mr Johnson is still popular amongst Tory members who will vote online next week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Less than two months after he left Downing Street.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Could Boris Johnson be about to return?

sentences.sentence: Yeah, I think it's highly likely he's going to breach the 100 MP level of support, which will allow him onto the ballot paper.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All the polls are showing that if he's on the ballot paper, the membership are going to back him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think that would be a retrograde step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think he's got a retrograde step. I think he's got a lot of baggage. Events of the last 12 months while he's been prime minister, I think, were unedifying for the country and the Conservative party and the government. But things have been so bad under Liz Truss that I think a lot of people are seeing him as a comfort blanket.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MPs must now decide who to put forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If only one candidate reaches 100 backers, they will be appointed Prime Minister on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.sentence: Europe is being hit by a wave of cocaine, according to Europol. Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London. Today, justice ministers from six Western European countries met and vowed to make entry points like harbours more secure amid a dramatic increase in drug traffic. For the last four years we have seen record seizures in Western Europe, so every consecutive

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: year with at least more than 240 tonnes of cocaine ceased in 2021, at least, probably more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Security officials have agreed to strengthen ties with Latin American partners such as Peru and Colombia, where the UN says identified coca leaf plantations have increased by at least 43% since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: coca leaf plantations have increased by at least 43% since 2020. Much of the product ends up in Europe and an EU report in May said record levels of drug trafficking are sparking violence across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After a two-day gathering in Brussels, EU leaders have agreed on an energy roadmap to tackle the challenge of soaring utility bills and gas shortages in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It is an extremely important agreement with an immediate effect because we have seen in recent hours a significant decrease in prices, which means that acting in unity, acting as Europeans has an impact and of course we will remain mobilised.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Heads of state and government appeared determined to preserve the appearance of a united EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They kept the option of capping gas prices on the table and called on the European Commission to work on extending the Iberian model, which regulates the cost of gas for electricity production to other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This would have to be accompanied by safeguards for countries like Germany who are against market intervention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We don't think that in a global market we can say unilaterally where the price should be.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The only thing we can do is to fight against speculation in the market which is giving wrong information about the real prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And so this is about spikes, about these episodes of excessive gas prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The leaders also agreed on the principle of joint gas purchases on a voluntary basis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This would mean the EU could use its commercial waste to negotiate with its so-called reliable suppliers. They also touched on international issues like relations with China. With ongoing geopolitical challenges posed by Beijing, the 27 reaffirmed their hope for more strategic autonomy in the area of energy, defense and technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Since 1984, the Turner Prize has been awarded annually to a contemporary artist born or living in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Four finalists have been shortlisted in this 38th edition of the prize, which is one of the world's most distinguished for visual arts. Works vary this year from traditional painting to video and performance art. The pieces are on display at Tate's Liverpool and the winner will be announced in December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: One of the most iconic Catholic cathedrals in Spain is hosting an exhibition containing a hyper-realistic and volumetric artwork entitled The Mystery Man.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The exhibition is the result of 15 years of research into the Holy Shroud of Turin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The relic believed to have been used to wrap Jesus' body after his death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Using analysis from the shroud, The Mystery Man exhibit includes a sculpture of what Jesus' body might have looked like after crucifixion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Every year in the southern French town of Montpellier, films from Spain, Greece, Tunisia, Israel, Palestine and across the Mediterranean region are showcased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And for the very first time, a couple will chair the jury of the Festival Cinemat. The actor Rashida Brakni and her partner, the famous footballer turned actor Eric Cantona.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This year's opening film was La Mensita by Italian director Emanuele Crialassi, starring Penelope Cruz.
